charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the number of publications in the Cancer domain, in the EU (at least one author is affiliated to an EU organization). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

charts.chartName: Share of publications in Cancer topics over time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the share of publications in different topics in the Cancer domain in the EU, over time. The ontology of topics has been inferred from the selected publications using Natural Language Processing techniques: Latent Dirichlet Allocation is used detect and categorize the topics, and ChatGPT is used to label them. Data Source: (OpenAIRE Graph)

charts.chartName: Open Access publications in Cancer over time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the number of scientific articles published in Open Access, and in the number of publications (any type) that can be found in Open Access in the OpenAIRE graph (best available access rights from any of the OpenAIRE data sources). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

label.name: Scientific articles published in Open Access

charts.description: The graph shows the number of publications in Cancer by the country of the affiliated organization of an author (with at least one author affiliated to an EU organization). In the case of multiple authors each organization and corresponding country is counted as a separate publication (e.g., one publication with three authors, where two are from Greece and one is from Spain is counted as two publications in Greece and one in Spain). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph
The graph shows the top 100 organizations in terms of the number of publications in Cancer with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph
The graph shows the number of grant-supported publications in Cancer with at least one author from an EU organization, by funder. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph
The graph shows top 50 journals by the number of scientific publications in Cancer, with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

The graph shows the total number of publications, superimposed with the number of those that are cited in patents, over time using data on publications and patents are in the Cancer domain in the EU. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Patstat - EPO dataset.

charts.chartName: Average citations per publication over time
charts.description: The graph shows the average number of citations per scientific publication in the Cancer domain, with at least one author from an EU organization, over time by the year of publication. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

label.name: Number of citations of scientific publications in Cancer domain

charts.description: The graph shows the total number of citations for scientific publications in Cancer with at least one author from an EU organization over time by the year of publication. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

label.name: Number of scientific publications in Cancer domain

charts.description: The graph shows the average number of citations per publication, in Cancer with at least one author from an EU organization, by the country of the affiliated organization of an author. In the case of multiple authors each organization and corresponding country is counted as a separate publication (e.g., one publication with three authors, where two are from Greece and one is from Spain is counted as two publications in Greece and one in Spain). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the top 100 organizations in terms of the average number of citations per publication in Cancer with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows citations per publication for grant-supported publications, by funder (for funders integrated in OpenAIRE – see Methodology for a list), in Cancer with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

charts.chartName: Publications cited in patents by topic in Cancer
charts.description: The graph shows the number of publications cited in patents by topic within the Cancer domain, both publications and patents are in the Cancer domain in the EU. The ontology of topics has been inferred from the selected publications using Natural Language Processing techniques: Latent Dirichlet Allocation is used detect and categorize the topics, and ChatGPT is used to label them. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Patstat - EPO dataset.

charts.chartName: Citations per publication by topic in Cancer
charts.description: The graph shows the average number of citations per scientific publication for different topics in the Cancer domain. The ontology of topics has been inferred from the selected publications using Natural Language Processing techniques: Latent Dirichlet Allocation is used detect and categorize the topics, and ChatGPT is used to label them. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the evolution in the number of publications in Cancer with authors affiliated to organizations in at least two different countries, one of which is in the EU. Superimposed is the number of those that are cited by at least one publication. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the number of publications with authors affiliated to organizations in at least two different countries, one of which is in the EU, by topic in the Cancer domain. The ontology of topics has been inferred from the selected publications using Natural Language Processing techniques: Latent Dirichlet Allocation is used detect and categorize the topics, and ChatGPT is used to label them. Data Sourc_: OpenAIRE Graph
The graph shows the evolution in the number of patents in the Cancer domain granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2 by priority year. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Share of patents in Cancer topics over time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the share of patents in different topics in the Cancer domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2. The ontology of topics is taken from the technical annex of the Final Report of the EU taxonomy for sustainable activities (Chapter 4. “Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply,” p. 205). We assigned patents to topics, by matching topics to CPC codes. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset
The graph shows the number of patents in the Cancer domain granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2 by the country of the applicant. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset
The graph shows the top 100 organizations of patent applicants in terms of the number of patents in the Cancer domain granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2.
The graph shows the number of patents in the Cancer domain granted by the EPO and currently valid (at least until 2021 Q2) by the type of patent applicant. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the number of patents in the Cancer domain granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2 by the NACE (Nomenclature of Economic Activities) codes of patents as assigned by PATSTAT. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the top 20 IPC (International Patent Classification) codes by the number of patents in the Cancer domain granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2 by IPC. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the number of patents by topic in the Cancer domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2. The ontology of topics is taken from the technical annex of the Final Report of the EU taxonomy for sustainable activities (Chapter 4. “Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply,” p. 205). We assigned patents to topics, by matching topics to CPC codes. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset
